item.title: Report E-2025040578
item.description:
Report E-2025040578

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-24
  • City: CAMP HILL
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The forklift driver was loading a short skid and did not recognize that his fork blade was poking out from the back side of the pallet. As he went to place the pallet, he forked the bottom the the jerrican. Hazwoper trained personnel immediately responded to the spill. Spill pads were put down to absorb the spilled adhesive material. The damaged jerrican was placed in an overpack. All spill clean up materials were placed in a separate overpack in preparation for disposition.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS LOADED IN T-P TRAILER, LOADER SAID HE HEARD PACKAGE HISSING/AND POPPED. HE WALKED IN IT WAS SPRAYING. LOADER GOT IT ON HIS CLOTHING AND FACE. RESPONDER TOLD HIM TO WASH IMMEDIATLY, AND LET THE SUPERVISOR KNOW. HE SAID HE WAS ALRIGHT AND REFUSED MEDICIAL ATTENTION.

item.title: Report E-2025040576
item.description:
Report E-2025040576

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-24
  • City: PITTSTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight, the spill was identified. Dock leadership was notified and a HAZWOPER trained employee was tasked with clean up. Investigation revealed that the original loader of the trailer had pushed pallets in behind the drums resulting in damage to the drum and a spill. Spill X powder was used to neutralize the liquid. The drum was placed in an overpack in preparation for disposition and to control any more spillage. All remnants of the spill were cleaned up placed in a separate overpack.

item.title: Report E-2025040538
item.description:
Report E-2025040538

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-22
  • City: JERMYN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 22, 2025, one (1) 44-pound box of V-50 was punctured and released approximately one (1) pound to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the site. The crew utilized hand tools to remediate the site All impacted materials and the damaged box were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025040534
item.description:
Report E-2025040534

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-21
  • City: KUTZTOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 53ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and 10ft-by-10ft area of concrete and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material were released due to forklift damaging one (1) poly tote. Hepaco personnel used Soda Ash to neutralize Hydrochloric acid. Contractor personnel deployed granular absorbents and absorbent pads to the affected areas. Hepaco personnel transferred the remaining product from the damaged drum to a new poly tote. The impacted absorbents were containerized into five (5) 55-gallon poly drums. Impacted PPE was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged tote was cut up and was put in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted plywood was put in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drums were staged onsite. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal
